1.text: Hast thou known the time of The bearing of the wild goats of the rock? The bringing forth of hinds thou dost mark!

2.text: Thou dost number the months they fulfil? And thou hast known the time of their bringing forth!

3.text: They bow down, Their young ones they bring forth safely, Their pangs they cast forth.

4.text: Safe are their young ones, They grow up in the field, they have gone out, And have not returned to them.

5.text: Who hath sent forth the wild ass free? Yea, the bands of the wild ass who opened?

6.text: Whose house I have made the wilderness, And his dwellings the barren land,

7.text: He doth laugh at the multitude of a city, The cries of an exactor he heareth not.

8.text: The range of mountains is his pasture, And after every green thing he seeketh.

9.text: Is a Reem willing to serve thee? Doth he lodge by thy crib?

10.text: Dost thou bind a Reem in a furrow with his thick band? Doth he harrow valleys after thee?

11.text: Dost thou trust in him because great is his power? And dost thou leave unto him thy labour?

12.text: Dost thou trust in him That he doth bring back thy seed? And to thy threshing-floor doth gather it?

13.text: The wing of the rattling ones exulteth, Whether the pinion of the ostrich or hawk.

14.text: For she leaveth on the earth her eggs, And on the dust she doth warm them,

15.text: And she forgetteth that a foot may press it, And a beast of the field tread it down.

16.text: Her young ones it hath hardened without her, In vain is her labour without fear.

17.text: For God hath caused her to forget wisdom, And He hath not given a portion To her in understanding:

18.text: At the time on high she lifteth herself up, She laugheth at the horse and at his rider.

19.text: Dost thou give to the horse might? Dost thou clothe his neck with a mane?

20.text: Dost thou cause him to rush as a locust? The majesty of his snorting is terrible.

21.text: They dig in a valley, and he rejoiceth in power, He goeth forth to meet the armour.

22.text: He laugheth at fear, and is not affrighted, And he turneth not back from the face of the sword.

23.text: Against him rattle doth quiver, The flame of a spear, and a halbert.

24.text: With trembling and rage he swalloweth the ground, And remaineth not stedfast Because of the sound of a trumpet.

25.text: Among the trumpets he saith, Aha, And from afar he doth smell battle, Roaring of princes and shouting.

26.text: By thine understanding flieth a hawk? Spreadeth he his wings to the south?

27.text: At thy command goeth an eagle up high? Or lifteth he up his nest?

28.text: A rock he doth inhabit, Yea, he lodgeth on the tooth of a rock, and fortress.

29.text: From thence he hath sought food, To a far off place his eyes look attentively,

30.text: And his brood gulp up blood, And where the pierced areâ€”there is he!
